articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The lightning overthrow of President Bashar al-Assad left Syrians, countries in the region and world powers nervous on Tuesday about what comes next as the rebel alliance took its first steps in a government transition.
articles.title: Syria's rebels work to form government, restore order after Assad ouster

articles.author: Laurie Chen, James Pomfret, Antoni Slodkowski
articles.description: Just over a year ago, China gave Bashar al-Assad and his wife a warm welcome during their six-day visit to the country, offering the former Syrian leader a rare break from years of international isolation since the start of a civil war in 2011.
articles.title: Assad's fall in Syria exposes limits of China's Middle East diplomacy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli strikes across the Gaza Strip killed at least 19 Palestinians overnight and on Tuesday, medics said, as Israeli tanks pushed into areas in central and southern parts of the enclave.
articles.title: Israeli forces kill at least 19 people in Gaza, rescue workers say

articles.author: Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu entered a Tel Aviv courthouse to take the stand for the first time in a long-running corruption trial that will likely force him to juggle between the courtroom and war room for weeks.
articles.title: Netanyahu to take the stand in his corruption trial for the first time

articles.author: Julio-Cesar Chavez, Andrew Hay, Joseph Ax
articles.description: The man suspected of killing UnitedHealth executive Brian Thompson in a brazen shooting outside a Manhattan hotel was arrested and arraigned on gun and forgery charges on Monday, ending a massive five-day manhunt.
articles.title: Suspect in killing of UnitedHealth executive Brian Thompson in custody

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's ruling party said on Tuesday that it was discussing Yoon's potential resignation as early as in February over the ongoing turmoil over his martial law attempt, and holding a snap election in April or May.
articles.title: South Korea's ruling party discusses Yoon's resignation in Feb before snap election

articles.author: Charlotte Van Campenhout
articles.description: France's new prime minister should come from the left and any coalition government must commit to pension changes and helping with the cost of living, the Socialists said ahead of new talks with the president and other parties on Tuesday.
articles.title: French Socialists repeat call for left-wing PM as Macron seeks coalition talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan's defence ministry reported a surge of Chinese military activity around the island on Tuesday, including 47 military aircraft, with Taiwan on high alert following the return of its president from a U.S. trip.
articles.title: Taiwan reports surge of Chinese military aircraft, ships operating nearby

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin's foreign intelligence chief said on Tuesday that Russia was close to achieving its goals in Ukraine with Moscow holding what he said was the strategic initiative in all areas in the war.
articles.title: Russia close to achieving goals in Ukraine war, Putin's spy chief says

articles.author: Monicah Mwangi, Aaron Ross
articles.description: Kenyan police fired teargas and arrested at least three people on Tuesday as hundreds protested in the capital Nairobi against a wave of femicides, a Reuters reporter and human rights activists said.
articles.title: Kenyan police fire teargas at protesters marching against femicide
